this some hot garbage. call me mccree the way i touch woman

Ah overwatch, once was a great game, a successor, now a shell of its past, a disaster among its rivals, something that flew so high and fell so hard. Oh and the lies, the LIES and the unfulfilled promises and the broken hearts of the fans.

This is how I feel about this game for the last 3 years, something that I loved, I enjoyed, a game where I could just escape the reality and enjoy the heroes I like and the unique, for that time, gameplay, it was so damn fun and interesting back then in 2017 when I started playing, and the unique and fun events that they deliver, the free lootboxes after every lvl up or 9 games in arcade, it was motivating to continue playing the game, the skins were awesome and cool. After a couple of years they stopped being so creative and delivered only new skin with every event, the events became really repetitive and started to bring no joy at all, the only motive to play these events were lootboxes for skins, I really like the lootbox system and haven't had troubles with it at all, after that, they announced overwatch 2 with long waited and wanted replayable PVE missions with hero trees and unique skills for every hero in mission, and they marinated the playerbase for 4 years without updates at all, no new heroes, maps or gamemodes, only little fixes here and there. 

At last, overwatch 2 was couples of weeks before release, they released a bundle, the operation pack with 2 skins and couple things, but most importantly, the PVE, you could but the pack and get pve on release, and there it is, overwatch 2 released, and with it, just in seconds, 4 years of waiting, 4 years of hope, were shuttered, there was no PVE on release, there was almost nothing, few maps that aren't even good, I almost don't even remember playing them, a new mode where you push the robot to the enemy spawn, which is not that great at all, they added 2 new heroes who are, in my opinion, a little soulless and a bit boring, even though I like paying them, and the most terrible, the worse shop and battlepass in the history that replaced lootboxes because the game became free to play, later they told us that PVE is delayed, after a few months they scrapped the only thing PVE was in development for so long, the hero trees, the just killed the whole purpose of the PVE, instead, they released 3 paid missions for 15$ every 1 or 2 season, and who knows if it's a one time pay to PVE or you'll need to pay 15$ every season to get these 3 missions, but what the dev team seems like, most likely its gonna be option 2.

The devs become money hungry dorks who only deliver skins and bundles for 40$, battle pass with little free stuff and so little coins that you can't even buy the next battle pass like in other games. They only listen to pro players and streamers that in top500 (last rank tier in the game) and buff unnecessary heroes or nerf, almost killing, unnecessary heroes that they become unplayable. There Is a problem with combos that become overpowered and uncontrollable that become the meta of the game and you see those combos in every game and so that it becomes boring to play against, some heroes get buffed to much and everyone plays them so you can't play your fav hero and must switch to try and counter them and then you'll just quit.

In conclusion, they promised so much, and delivered nothing, with every update, something in the game brakes and we need to wait for the next one, battle passes are greedy and the rewards are lame, shop is to expensive for skins where you see only your weapon and a little of your hands, you rather buy a good game with that money instead spending it on pixels that you can do nothing with unlike CS, don't feed the dogs anymore money so the understand that the playerbase is upset with them, please be smarter.

And for the new players, laly better and much more enjoyable games then that, after 1500+ hours I can say that it was a rollercoaster or emotions I have no hope anymore for these devs and game, the game overall is a cool and fun concept, but the devs ruined it from all directions, its not worth the mental DMG that the game and it's toxic community will cause, much more toxic than league, stay away, please, for you own good, watch yourselves!

Over 1k hrs on battle.net
Pros:
- great gameplay
- each hero is a completely unique experience
- not mechanics heavy. I love competitive games, but games that are mechanically dependent (aim) just feel terrible for me. You can reach top 500 with terrible aim

Cons:
- ActiBlizz. The new team is sending overwatch in a different direction and it's missing the love that the original overwatch was created with. What remains is absolutely still worth playing, but it's sad seeing it mismanaged
- pve is a shell of what was originally envisioned (due to mismanagement and turnover)
